title: Honoring Officer Terry Mayone upon the occasion of his retirement from the Village of Saugerties Police Department
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring Officer Terry Mayone upon the occasion
of his retirement from the Village of Saugerties Police Department

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize and honor
those distinguished officers and citizens who would devote themselves to
public service, demonstrating great courage and diligence  in  providing
for  the  care and welfare of the citizens of their communities and this
great Empire State; and
  WHEREAS, Within every community of the State of  New  York  there  are
certain  individuals  who, by virtue of their commitment and dedication,
command the respect and admiration of their community  for  their  exem-
plary contributions and service on behalf of others; and
  WHEREAS,  This Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Officer Terry
Mayone upon the occasion of his retirement from the Village  of  Sauger-
ties Police Department; and
  WHEREAS,  Police  Officer  Terry  Mayone  of the Village of Saugerties
Police Department has announced his retirement  after  25  years  and  8
months  of honorable service; he started his career on July 16, 1984 and
served until March 18, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, Officer Mayone received several awards and other police cita-
tions throughout his career; he also was recognized by several other law
enforcement and government agencies, which are: the Ulster County Police
Chiefs Association, the New York State Police  Chiefs  Association,  the
New  York  State  Conference of Mayors, the New York State Assembly, the
New York State Senate, the New York  State  Police,  the  Ulster  County
Legislature, the Ulster County Shields, the Village Board of Saugerties,
and the Village of Saugerties Police Department; and
  WHEREAS,  In  1991, Officer Mayone implemented the Boat Patrol for his
department in the upper and lower Esopus Creek; in 1993, he received  an
award for Policeman of the Year from the Village of Saugerties; and
  WHEREAS,  In  November  of 2001, Officer Mayone received a Life Saving
Award, which involved a water safety rescue and resulted in  saving  the
life of a woman; in April of 2002, he made one of the Department's larg-
est drug arrests; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that those dedicated
public  servants  who unselfishly devote their lives to the preservation
of order and the protection of others are worthy and due full praise for
their commitment and noble endeavors; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  Officer Terry Mayone upon the occasion of his retirement from the
Village of Saugerties Police Department; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Police Officer Terry Mayone.
